text: I grew up on a farm in North Carolina so
grew up within agriculture that's always
a part of my upbringing
looking at the schools that are out
there you know a lot of beautiful
options but HBS like really just
resonated with me not so much because
they have strengths in agriculture but
because of what the school embodies and
then the social Enterprise initiative
within it and that got me really really
excited
I was in Rwanda last January for an ixp
I led a team of three students we're
looking at how to mobilize private
sector financing for post-harvest
handling and storage facilities in rural
Rwanda
so last summer I worked for root Capital
which is an impact investment fund where
I worked in Tanzania supporting Agro
processors that they were thinking about
bringing into their loan portfolio I was
on my own in Northern Tanzania the only
employee for the organization in the
area and I spent six days a week at
different Agri processors some in Dairy
some in Grain Milling you know we looked
at these processors as a real
opportunity if we can strengthen the
aggro processing capabilities within
this region then we can provide you know
a bigger Market greater market for these
Farmers to supply to as well as we're on
the on the consumer side we're creating
nutritional products
so when I came across Anheuser-Busch in
Bev and we had a great conversation here
on campus and it really kept passed
along and here we are today
my job will be within the global
procurement group I'll be responsible
for developing raw material supply
chains in Emerging Markets so a great
opportunity for us is we enter
commercially into China and India
specifically or we think about you know
what the opportunities are in Africa or
expanding our reach in Eastern Europe
living in Belgium I think it's going to
be brilliant I'm really excited about it
they have the best beer in the world in
my mind there so I'm excited to live in
Europe but I think it'll be quite
International above and beyond Europe as
well
foreign
